address.label: IP Address
address.helper: For a PSTN gateway: IP address of the gateway (example: 10.1.1.1) or the fully qualified hostname of the gateway (example: gateway.example.com). The gateway can be on any routed subnet without NAT. For an ITSP SIP Trunk: External IP address or fully qualified hostname of the Internet Telephony Service Provider (e.g. itsp.example.com). Note: An SBC Route needs to be defined in the field below. For a Direct SIP Trunk: To interconnect two VoIP systems using SIP enter the IP address or fully qualified name of the other system.

serialNumber.helper: Usually the serial number is set to the device's MAC address, for example: 0040214131fa.

shared.helper: If checked this gateway can be used by any user in any location, even if a specific location is selected. This setting is checked by default so that users in an identified location still use their preferred gateway, but the gateway can also be used by other users in other locations.

defaultCallerId.helper: Caller ID used for all the calls connected through this gateway, unless more specific caller ID is specified for the user making the call.

displayName.helper: Name that appears on the phone when the call is received. Different gateways or ITSPs handle this field differently, so that actual results will vary. Some phones may not support displaying this value correctly.

urlParameters.helper: Optional SIP URI parameters of the following form: key1=value1;key2=value2

blockCallerId.helper: If checked all calls connected through this gateway will have Caller ID blocked, unless more specific Caller ID is specified for the user.

ignoreUserCallerId.helper: If checked only gateway default Caller ID and Block Caller ID options are considered by this gateway.

transformExtension.helper: If checked gateway will produce Caller ID by transforming the user extension using the rules for Caller ID prefix and number of digits to keep. If not checked the Caller ID specified for the user or for the gateway will be used.

callerIdPrefix.helper: Optional prefix added to the user extension to create the Caller ID.

keepDigits.helper: Number of extension digits that are kept before adding the Caller ID prefix. If the user extension has more digits than configured here, leading digits are dropped when creating the Caller ID. The default value of 0 means keeping all digits.

prefix.helper: Prefix that will be added to all numbers for calls connected through this gateway.

rDTMFnm.title: Firmware version
enum: No declaration of RFC2833 in SDP

ddml.helper: Maximum number of digits that can be dialed

idt.helper: Dial time out before end-of-dial recognized.

tDTNFnm.helper: DTMF negotiation methods are prioritized according to the order of their appearance

RFC2833DTMFpt.helper: RFC2833 DTMF Relay dynamic payload type. Allowed ranges are: 96 - 99 and 106 - 127

ecdobc.title: Enable Call Disconnect on Broken Connection

ecdofes.title: Enable Call Disconnect on Far End Silence

SecSIPCalls.helper: If enabled, gateways will only accept SIP calls from IP addresses listed as 'Accepted IP Addresses' or as proxy addresses in 'PSTN to IP Call Routing'.

AcceptIPAddr.helper: Space separated list of additional IP addresses from which gateway will accept calls (these are in addition to the proxy addresses in 'PSTN to IP Call Routing'). These addresses are taken into account only if Secure SIP Calls is enabled.

ddttp.helper: Enables digit string to be played to the port at the far end, after off-hook.

ecdobc.helper: If checked, call is released if gateways stops receiving RTP for a period of time

brokenConnectionTimeout.helper: Amount of time (in 100ms units) with no RTP received, after which the call is released.

ecdofes.helper: If checked, enable disconnection of call based on silence

silPerForDisc.helper: Detection period, in seconds, before call is released based on silence

silThreshold.helper: Threshold of packet count, in percentage, below which is considered as silence.

detLevInDebLog.helper: Detail level of the log messages in syslog. Default is 0 (off), max is 5 (full)

cdrServIPAddr.helper: Optional separate Syslog server to collect CDRs only. If null and CDR is enabled, the output is mixed with the log messages and is routed to the Syslog server IP.

pboMethod.helper: 0: Disabled, 1: Telephony ports are busied out (special tone) in case of LAN failure, or Proxy communication failure.

sasBindMode.helper: Determines the SAS application database binding mode. [0]: URI = If the incoming AoR in the INVITE requests is using a tel: URI or user=phone is defined, the binding is performed according to the user part of the URI only. Otherwise, the binding is according to the entire URI, i.e., User@Host (default). [1]: User Part only = The binding is always performed according to the User Part only.

sasSurvMode.helper: The Survivability mode used by the SAS application. 0:standard; 1:Always Emergency; 2:Ignore Register

sasEnableENUM.helper: Determines whether the SAS application uses ENUM queries to route incoming INVITE requests when in Emergency mode.

sasLocSipUdpPort.helper: UDP Port for SAS SIP signaling

sasLocSipTcpPort.helper: TCP Port for SAS SIP signaling

sasLocSipTLSPort.helper: TLS Port for SAS SIP signaling

sasProxySet.helper: Determines the Proxy Set (index number) used in SAS Normal mode to forward REGISTER and INVITE requests from the users that are served by the SAS application.

rSasProxySet.helper: Determines the Proxy Set (index number) used in SAS Emergency mode for fallback when the user is not found in the Registered Users database.

destNumMan.helper: The same manipulation is done in both Normal Mode and Failover Mode so care needs to be taken when setting up Stand-Alone Survivability. A single prefix can provide a range of values, for example 'dest prefix=91xxxxxxxxxx|9011x'. Manipulation string format is '<dest prefix>, <src prefix>, <strip from left>, <strip from right>' , so the string '*, *, 0, 0' will match everything and do nothing. Manipulations are processed in order starting with the first one in the list below.

normModeRout.helper: In Normal Mode the gateway should typically not need to manipulate the destination number, so these settings should contain default values.

destNumMan.helper: Manipulation string format is '<dest prefix>, <src prefix>, <strip from left>, <strip from right>', so the string '*, *, 0, 0' will match everything and do nothing.

failModeRout.helper: In Failover Mode the gateway may need to do some number manipulation, e.g. for the incoming PSTN number '6135551234' it would need to drop leading digits in order to route to the user '1234', so in this example configure the 'dest prefix=613555' and the 'strip from left=6'.

destNumMan.helper: Manipulation string format is '<dest prefix>, <src prefix>, <strip from left>, <strip from right>', so the string '*, *, 0, 0' will match everything and do nothing.

callingPN.title: Calling Party Number for PSTN MWI

calledPN.title: Called Party Number for PSTN MWI

calledPN.helper: The default uses the User ID as the called number

tdmBusPstnAC.title: TDM Bus PSTN Auto Clock
enum: Recover clock from Local Reference Only
Recover clock from any synchronized trunk

E1T1Settings.helper: E1/T1 trunk parameters shared by all trunks.

pcmLawSel.helper: Usually A-Law is used for E1 spans and µ-Law for T1 and J1 spans

tdmBusLR.helper: Trunk from which clock will be recovered.

pubAddrNat.helper: IP address of the gateway as seen from the outside of NAT

ntpServIpAddr.helper: IP address of the NTP Server to sync time/date with

primStunServIpAddr.helper: IP address of the primary STUN server

secStunServIpAddr.helper: IP address of the secondary STUN server

syslogServIpAddr.helper: The IP address of the Syslog server

dtmfTnasOpt.title: DTMF Transport Options
enum: Erase digit from voice stream, realy as RFC2833

faxTransMode.title: Fax Transport Codec in By-Pass Mode

faxTransPayIdBPMode.title: Fax Transport Payload ID in By-Pass Mode

dtmfVolume.helper: DTMF gain control value in dB (to the analog side)

faxTransPayIdBPMode.helper: Payload type for by-pass fax transport, 96 thru 120

faxRelRedDepth.helper: Number of times that each fax relay payload is retransmitted to the network

faxRelEnhRedDepth.helper: Number of times that control packets are retransmitted when using the T.38 standard

faxRelMaxRate.helper: Maximum rate at which fax relay messages are transmitted (outgoing calls)

faxModemBPF.helper: Number of (20 msec) coder payloads that are used to generate a fax/modem bypass packet.

cngDetMode.helper: In Relay mode, CNG is detected on the originating side. CNG packets are sent to the remote side according to T.38 and the fax session is started. In Events Only mode, CNG is detected on the originating side. The CNG signal passes transparently to the remote side and fax session is started.

enCallerId.helper: Enable generation (FXS) and detection (FXO) of Caller ID on the telephony ports

lifeLineType.title: LifeLine Type
enum: Power down or ethernet link down
Power down or ethernet link down or network down

jitBufMinDel.helper: Jitter buffer minimum delay, in milliseconds

rfc2198Payl.helper: Applicable only if RTP Redundancy Depth is enabled

RFC 3389 CN Payload.helper: If Enabled SID (comfort noise) packets are sent with the RTP SID payload type according to RFC 3389. Applicable to G.711 and G.726 coders. Otherwise proprietaty method is used.

countryVariant.helper: country variant for line characteristics. North America = 70

enableSnmp.helper: Enable/disable external SNMP manager to receive alarms/traps

EnableSnmpTrapSend.helper: Enable/disable sending traps to external SNMP manager

snmpTrustManConf.helper: Enable/disable SNMP-based configuration control, and manager IP

snmip.title: Source Number Map from IP to Tel

telToIpNoAnswerTimeout.title: Tel to IP No Answer Timeout

useSNAsDisplayName.title: Use Source Number as Display Name

useDNAsSourceNumber.title: Use Display Name as Source Number

snmip.helper: Manipulate the source number for IP to Tel calls (see Audicodes documentation for details). When certain NI-2 protocol configured central offices require calling name to be disabled. Set this to: *,0,$$,$$,$$,$$,*,1,*

remCliRestricted.helper: The Remove CLI when restricted (for IP to Tel calls) determines whether the Calling Number IE and Calling Name IE are removed from the outgoing ISDN Setup message if the presentation is set to Restricted. Typically used in certain NI-2 protocol enabled carriers.

assertedIdMode.helper: The Asserted ID mode defines the header that is used in the generated INVITE request. The header also depends on the calling Privacy: allowed or restricted

optionLabels: Don't include Number Plan and Type

sdpSessionOwner.helper: The value of the Session Owner line ("o" field) in outgoing SDP bodies. May be up to 39 characters.

3xxBehavior.helper: Determines the gateway's behavior when a 3xx response is received for an outgoing INVITE request. The gateway can either use the same call identifiers (CallID, branch, to and from tags) or change them in the new initiated INVITE. When enabled gateway will use the same call identifiers.

sipReroutingMode.helper: Determines the routing mode after a call redirection or transfer. [0]: Standard = INVITE messages that are generated as a result of Transfer or Redirect are sent directly to the URI, according to the Refer-To header in the REFER message or Contact header in the 3xx response (default). [1]: Proxy = Sends a new INVITE to the Proxy. Note: Applicable only if a Proxy server is used and the parameter AlwaysSendtoProxy is set to 0. [2]: Routing Table = Uses the Routing table to locate the destination and then sends a new INVITE to this destination

enablePCVector.helper: If checked, adds a P-Charging-Vector header to outgoing INVITE messages.

enableVoicemailURI.helper: Enables or disables the interworking of target and cause for redirection from Tel to IP and vice versa, according to RFC 4468.

codec.helper: List of preferred codecs in the order of priority.

userName.helper: User name used for Registration and Basic/Digest authentication with a Proxy / Registrar server. Applicable only if single device registration is used (i.e., Authentication Mode is set to Authentication Per gateway).

password.helper: The password used for Basic/Digest authentication with a Proxy / Registrar server. A single password is used for all device ports.

tdmBusPstnAC: Recover clock from Local Reference Only

dtmfTransOpt: Erase digit from voice stream, realy as RFC2833
